thread.title: Footie fan's comments on Dublin drinks prices sparks huge backlash from Irish locals
thread.title_full: Footie fan's comments on Dublin drinks prices sparks huge backlash from Irish locals

author: Joshua Barrie
title: Footie fan's comments on Dublin drinks prices sparks huge backlash from Irish locals
text:
Footie fan's comments on Dublin drinks prices sparks huge backlash from Irish locals He went to the wrong bar Share It's a good night, but there are better venues Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
A football fan went to Dublin's famous Temple Bar and ordered a round of drinks. There were issues. 
After going all in on some Guinness, lager, cider, and gin, tourist Gavin Allen was left disgruntled by the prices â€“ which, let's be fair, aren't on the cheap side. 
Gavin, who works for the Mirror , tweeted a picture of his bill after realising he'd just forked out more than 17 euros on a gin and tonic and seven euros on a Carlsberg. 
All in all, Gavin spent more than 70 euros on the round. He was in Dublin to see Saturday's football match between Ireland and Wales. The game ended 0-0. Fairly extortionate (Photo: @Gavinallen/Twitter)
